meanings.definition: The act of making four copies or reproductions of something.
meanings.sent1: She needed quadruplications of the report for all the team members.
meanings.sent2: The artist proudly displayed the quadruplications of her masterpiece in the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The office printer went crazy and produced quadruplications of the same document.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like quadruplications of a beautiful melody, echoing in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The quadruplications of the ancient manuscript revealed hidden details.

meanings.definition: A set of four identical copies or reproductions of something.
meanings.sent1: The library had a collection of quadruplications of rare books for preservation.
meanings.sent2: She handed out quadruplications of the flyer to each member of the audience.
meanings.sent3: The kids played a game of passing quadruplications of a drawing around the room.
meanings.sent4: The four siblings looked like quadruplications of each other with their matching outfits.
meanings.sent5: The quadruplications of the painting were indistinguishable from the original.
